content: Is there any interest in participating in a subscription track in January? We've missed the deadline, but I think we can carry forward what we looked at last time/carry on if there's interest.
I'm interested, but not sure how much time I will have
I created this from our previous tracks: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=210901_FHIR_Subscriptions
The Public Health track will be working with subscription.
we are planning to add a subscription transaction to VHDIR too.
Ok, given late interest/comments above, I have the official track up and will be there to run it.
Here's the link to the connectathon app: http://conman.fhir.org/connectathon.html?event=sanant2019
Cerner's server is listed in the "Servers" tab at the top
Here are some notes on how to use Cerner's server https://github.com/MaxPhilips/wgm_notes/blob/jan_2019/subscriptions/test_server_faq.md
added some information about the /notify endpoint you can use to trigger subscriptions
Here is a client I made today that can create subscriptions and receive notifications: http://ec2-18-222-237-133.us-east-2.compute.amazonaws.com/subscription/home
Hey all, we'll do a quick standup outside the ballroom at 12. I want to review questions, discussion we've had, and any input we may want to supply back to the spec!
Reminder, we'll be meeting just outside the ballroom in 7 minutes!

many people have talked about what FHIR versions are available today in the US. Michele has a great spreadsheet he maintains linked here: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179166-implementers/topic/EHR.20support.20for.20FHIR

I have a draft of our Outcomes here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=210901_FHIR_Subscriptions#Outcomes

Let me know if you would like me to add specific summaries for your server or goals!
